clinical_study.brief_title: Laparoscopic Assisted Transanal Total Mesorectal Excision for Rectal Cancer in Low Site
clinical_study.official_title: Laparoscopic Assisted transAnal Total Mesorectal Excision for Rectal cAncer in Low Site :A Prospective,Multi-center, Patients Registry Trial in China (LATERAL Trial)

collaborator.agency: Daping Hospital and the Research Institute of Surgery of the Third Military Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: At present, surgical resection is still the main treatment for the potential cure of rectal cancer. Total mesorectal excision (TME) is the gold standard. The traditional laparoscopic or open surgery for some special patients is really difficult, especially for male, prostate hypertrophy, obesity, low tumor and pelvic stenosis patients to expose the gap around the mesorectum and separate to the pelvic floor. While transanal total mesorectal excision (TaTME) approach could be more directly separate the low mesorectum and relatively simple to complete distal rectal transection, which would bring some considerable advantages. Although active learning from abroad, laparoscopic assisted TaTME surgery is now in its infancy in China. It is urgent for clinical studies to obtain the results in China. This multicenter, observational study will help to encourage research in this field and to obtain data on the safety and efficacy of this procedure in Chinese patients with rectal cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Positive rate of circumferential resection margin (CRM) of the specimens
primary_outcome.description: Circumferential resection margin (CRM) is the distance between the deepest point of tumor in the primary cancer and the margin of resection in the retroperitoneum or mesentery by pathological examination. CRM 0-1mm is defined as positive, while >1mm is negative.

secondary_outcome.measure: The grade score of the specimens integrity
secondary_outcome.description: shows the quality of the specimens: grade 1 is bad gross specimen which means incomplete mesorectum and pelvic fascia, and muscle layer can be see >5mm; grade 3 is high quality gross specimen, which means the specimen is cylindrical, mesorectum and pelvic fascia are complete; grade 2 is between 1and 3.

secondary_outcome.measure: The distance between lower tumor margin and the lower reaction margin
secondary_outcome.description: shows the oncological safety of the surgery by pathological examination. Reports should contain the distance between lower tumor margin and the lower reaction margin.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adenocarcinoma of the rectum by biopsy
- the lower edge of the tumor from the anal margin less than 6cm according to MRI or rigid endoscopy
- tumor diameter less than 4cm
- baseline clinical stage I-III: cT1-3 N0-2 M0 (AJCC v7)
- tolerable to surgery
- be able to understand and willing to participate in this trial with signature
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of malignant colorectal neoplasia
- recent diagnosis with other malignancies
- patients requiring emergency surgery such as obstructionï¼Œperforation and bleeding
- tumor involving adjacent organs, anal sphincter, or levator ani muscle
- muti-focal colorectal cancer
- preoperative poor anal function, anal stenosis, anal injury, or fecal incontinence
- history of inflammatory bowel disease or familial adenomatous polyposis
- participating in other clinical trails
- can not tolerate the surgery
- history of serious mental illness
- pregnancy or lactating women
- preoperative uncontrolled infection
- the researchers believe the patients should not enrolled in
